instructions.name: Preheat
instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F

instructions.name: Mix dry ingredients
instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt

instructions.name: Add wet ingredients
instructions.text: Make a well in the flour/butter mixture and add the buttermilk.

instructions.name: Mix ingredients
instructions.text: Mix until a very loose dough forms, then turn the dough out onto a heavy floured work surface.

instructions.name: Roll
instructions.text: Gently roll the dough out to a rectangle about 12” x 9”. Using a bench scraper, fold the rectangle in thirds.

instructions.name: Add layers
instructions.text: Re-flour the work surface and rotate the dough 90°. Repeat the rolling, folding, and rotating method five times to create a network of flaky butter layers.

instructions.name: Chill
instructions.text: Wrap the final dough envelope in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes or up to overnight.

instructions.name: Roll
instructions.text: Flour the work surface once more and place the chilled dough in the center. Roll the dough out to a rectangle about 10” x 6” and ½ inch in thickness.

instructions.name: Cut biscuits
instructions.text: Using a very sharp blade, cut off the edges to form a perfect rectangle. Then cut the rectangle in half lengthwise and again, in thirds horizontally. The result should be 6 equally sized biscuits. Be sure not to touch the cut sides with your fingers, this will cause the biscuits to bake unevenly.

instructions.name: Prep for cooking
instructions.text: Transfer the biscuits to a large rimmed baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Brush them with melted butter and a sprinkling of finishing salt.

instructions.name: Bake
instructions.text: Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and doubled in height.

instructions.name: Cool
instructions.text: Allow the biscuits to cool slightly on a wire rack before slicing in half and/or serving.
